statement: Determine all three-digit numbers \(N\) that are divisible by 11 and satisfy \(N/11 =\) (sum of the squares of the digits of \(N\)).
For what real values of \(x\) does \(\frac{4x^2}{(1 - \sqrt{1 + 2x})^2} < 2x + 9\) hold?

In right triangle \(ABC\) with hypotenuse \(BC = a\) divided into \(n\) equal parts (\(n\) odd), let \(\alpha\) be the acute angle subtended from \(A\) by the segment containing the midpoint of \(BC\) and let \(h\) be the altitude to \(BC\). Prove \(\tan \alpha = \frac{4nh}{(n^2 - 1)a}\).
Construct triangle \(ABC\) given the altitudes \(h_a, h_b\) and the median \(m_a\) from vertex \(A\).

In cube \(ABCDA'B'C'D'\): (a) Find the locus of midpoints of segments \(XY\) with \(X\) on diagonal \(AC\) and \(Y\) on diagonal \(B'D'\). (b) Find the locus of points \(Z\) on such segments \(XY\) with \(ZY = 2XZ\).

A cone of revolution contains an inscribed sphere tangent to its base. A cylinder circumscribes this sphere with one base in the cone's base. Let \(V_1\) and \(V_2\) be the volumes of cone and cylinder. (a) Prove \(V_1 \neq V_2\). (b) Find the smallest \(k\) such that \(V_1 = k V_2\) and construct the angle subtended by a diameter of the base at the cone's vertex.

An isosceles trapezoid with bases \(a, c\) and altitude \(h\) is given. (a) On its axis of symmetry find all points \(P\) such that both legs subtend right angles at \(P\). (b) Calculate the distance of \(P\) from either base. (c) Determine under what conditions such points \(P\) exist.
